It also abolished IL-4-induced upregulation of CD40 but promoted upregulation of CD23.
('IL-4', 'Positive_regulation', 'CD23')

A human IL-5 promoter/enhancer luciferase gene construct transfected into IL-5-producing T cell clones was clearly transcribed after stimulation, indicating that the 515 base pair IL-5 gene segment upstream of the coding region was sufficient to respond to activating signals in human helper T cells.
('IL-5', 'Gene_expression', 'IL-5')

The same gene segment was not transcribed in IL-5-nonproducing T cell clones, suggesting that human T cell IL-5 synthesis is regulated at the transcriptional level.
('IL-5', 'Gene_expression', 'IL-5')

We demonstrate that IKKbeta-mediated RPS3 S209 phosphorylation represents a critical determinant in governing its nuclear import thus unveiling a novel mechanism behind NF-kappaB regulatory specificity.
('IKKbeta', 'Phosphorylation', 'RPS3')

The recent observation that human IKKbeta displayed CK2-like phosphorylation specificity29 coincides with our evidence that recombinant IKKbeta, but not IKKalpha, phosphorylated RPS3.
('IKKbeta', 'Phosphorylation', 'RPS3')

CK2 was previously shown to phosphorylate p65 and to bind to and phosphorylate IKKbeta41-43, however, we ruled out the possibility that the IKKbeta-bound CK2 could account for the observed RPS3 phosphorylation because no CK2 was detected in the IKKbeta preparations used for the in vitro kinase assay.
('IKKbeta', 'Phosphorylation', 'RPS3')

Because RPS3 only harbors the CK2 motif and not a traditional IKK motif, this RPS3 regulatory function could explain why IKK harbors the alternative substrate phosphorylation capability.
('RPS3', 'Localization', 'RPS3')

IKKbeta-mediated RPS3 S209 phosphorylation is a critical target modulated by this pathogen to subvert host NF-kappaB signaling.
('IKKbeta', 'Phosphorylation', 'RPS3')

The bacterial effector NleH1 specifically binds to RPS3 once injected into host cells and profoundly suppresses NF-kappaB and its attendant protective immune responses9.
('NleH1', 'Phosphorylation', 'RPS3')

Our data now show that NleH1 selectively inhibits RPS3 phosphorylation, thus retarding its nuclear translocation and subsequent NF-kappaB function, without altering other NF-kappaB signaling.
('NleH1', 'Phosphorylation', 'RPS3')

Although NleH1 did not directly phosphorylate IKKbeta, its kinase activity was required to inhibit IKKbeta-mediated RPS3 S209 phosphorylation.
('NleH1', 'Phosphorylation', 'RPS3'),('IKKbeta', 'Phosphorylation', 'RPS3')

NleH1 attenuates the transcription of RPS3-dependent, but not all, NF-kappaB target genes, in particular those genes associated with acute proinflammatory responses, including IL8 and TNF.
('NleH1', 'Phosphorylation', 'RPS3')

In contrast, NleH1 does not block NF-kappaB p65 nuclear translocation, which suggests that certain p65-dependent but RPS3-independent NF-kappaB target genes might thus be beneficial for E. coli O157:H7 to replicate and disseminate in the host.
('NleH1', 'Phosphorylation', 'RPS3'),('NleH1', 'Localization', 'p65')

By selectively inhibiting RPS3 and its attendant NF-kappaB function with NleH1, the pathogen achieves the ability to increase colonization and diarrhea yet limiting the mortality of the host.
('NleH1', 'Phosphorylation', 'RPS3')

EBNA-2 trans-activates cellular and viral genes like CD23, c-fgr, latent membrane protein 1 (LMP1) and terminal protein 1 (TP1).
('EBNA-2', 'Positive_regulation', 'LMP'),('EBNA-2', 'Gene_expression', 'LMP')

EBNA-2 is able to trans-activate the expression of the LMP gene in several cell lines.
('EBNA-2', 'Positive_regulation', 'LMP'),('EBNA-2', 'Gene_expression', 'LMP')

Various reports have delineated the cis-acting elements of the LMP promoter through which EBNA-2 mediates trans-activation.
('EBNA-2', 'Positive_regulation', 'LMP'),('EBNA-2', 'Gene_expression', 'LMP')

To determine whether EBNA-2 also trans-activates the LMP promoter by protein-protein interactions, we performed a series of gel retardation assays and competition experiments with LMP promoter fragments of different sizes.
('EBNA-2', 'Positive_regulation', 'LMP'),('EBNA-2', 'Gene_expression', 'LMP')

However, analysis of sucrose gradient fractions in the gel retardation assay provided evidence that the LMP promoter-binding proteins form a complex of higher M(r) in EBNA-2-positive cell extracts.
('EBNA-2', 'Positive_regulation', 'LMP'),('EBNA-2', 'Gene_expression', 'LMP')

We deduce from these results that EBNA-2-positive cells might indeed contain specific complexes bound to the LMP promoter which are, however, too labile to be detected in a standard gel retardation assay.
('EBNA-2', 'Positive_regulation', 'LMP'),('EBNA-2', 'Gene_expression', 'LMP')

BMP-6 inhibits growth of mature human B cells; induction of Smad phosphorylation and upregulation of Id1
('Smad', 'Positive_regulation', 'Id1')

The B cells were found to express BMP type I and type II receptors and BMP-6 rapidly induced phosphorylation of Smad1/5/8.
('BMP-6', 'Phosphorylation', '8'),('BMP-6', 'Phosphorylation', 'Smad1'),('BMP-6', 'Phosphorylation', '5')

Furthermore, Smad-phosphorylation was followed by upregulation of Id1 mRNA and Id1 protein, whereas Id2 and Id3 expression was not affected.
('Smad', 'Gene_expression', 'Id3'),('Smad', 'Positive_regulation', 'Id1'),('Smad', 'Gene_expression', 'Id2')

In mature human B cells, BMP-6 inhibited cell growth, and rapidly induced phosphorylation of Smad1/5/8 followed by an upregulation of Id1.
('Smad', 'Positive_regulation', 'Id1'),('BMP-6', 'Phosphorylation', '8'),('Smad1', 'Positive_regulation', 'Id1'),('BMP-6', 'Phosphorylation', 'Smad1'),('BMP-6', 'Phosphorylation', '5'),('8', 'Positive_regulation', 'Id1'),('5', 'Positive_regulation', 'Id1')

Activation of the erythropoietin receptor caused specific DNA-binding of Stat 5b, but failed to induce reporter gene transcription.
('erythropoietin receptor', 'Binding', 'Stat 5b')

The current study clearly demonstrates that IL-2 does not induce I kappa B alpha degradation or NF-kappa B activation in primary human T cells that respond to IL-2 by entering the cell cycle and avoiding apoptosis.
('IL-2', 'Protein_catabolism', 'I kappa B alpha')

However, this deletion mutation prevented the induced phosphorylation, degradative loss, and functional release of I kappa B alpha from NF-kappa B in Tax-expressing cells.
('Tax', 'Phosphorylation', 'I kappa B alpha'),('Tax', 'Protein_catabolism', 'I kappa B alpha')

Alanine substitutions introduced at two serine residues positioned within this N-terminal regulatory region of I kappa B alpha also yielded constitutive repressors that escaped from Tax-induced turnover and that potently inhibited immune activation pathways for NF-kappa B induction, including those initiated from antigen and cytokine receptors.
('Tax', 'Phosphorylation', 'I kappa B alpha'),('Tax', 'Protein_catabolism', 'I kappa B alpha')

Overexpression of NF-IL6 enhanced expression of the chloramphenicol acetyl transferase reporter gene linked to the PRE-I-thymidine kinase or the human IL-4 promoter more than 10-fold in Jurkat cells.
('NF-IL6', 'Positive_regulation', 'IL-4')

Our results demonstrate that NF-IL6 is involved in transcriptional activation of the human IL-4 promoter in T cells.
('NF-IL6', 'Positive_regulation', 'IL-4')

Although GABP expression is not restricted to the hematopoietic lineage, its interaction with other specific factors may contribute to the tissue-specific expression of the gammac gene.
('GABP', 'Gene_expression', 'gammac')

Importantly, BMP-6 induced a rapid and marked increase in Smad-1/5/8 phosphorylation.
('BMP-6', 'Phosphorylation', 'Smad')

Furthermore, the BMP-6 induced Smad phosphorylation was followed by a selective upregulation of Id1 mRNA and subsequent Id1 protein.
('Smad', 'Positive_regulation', 'Id1'),('BMP-6', 'Positive_regulation', 'Id1'),('BMP-6', 'Phosphorylation', 'Smad')

Furthermore, BMP-2 has been shown to induce activation of STAT3 in myeloma cells [9].
('BMP-2', 'Positive_regulation', 'STAT3')

Upregulation of Id1 via Smad1/5/8 phosphorylation is a known mechanism for BMP-6 signalling in other cell systems [31,32] and regulation of Id-proteins is thought to be an important mechanism for Smad-signalling [17].
('Smad1', 'Positive_regulation', 'Id1'),('Smad', 'Positive_regulation', 'Id1'),('5', 'Positive_regulation', 'Id1'),('BMP-6', 'Positive_regulation', 'Id1'),('BMP-6', 'Phosphorylation', 'Smad'),('8', 'Positive_regulation', 'Id1')

In the present study, real-time RT-PCR experiments revealed a specific four-fold upregulation for Id1 in BMP-6-treated B cells, while the amount of Id2-Id4 remained unchanged.
('BMP-6', 'Positive_regulation', 'Id1'),('BMP-6', 'Gene_expression', 'Id2'),('BMP-6', 'Gene_expression', 'Id4')

Previously, Id1 has been considered not to be expressed in later developmental stages than pro-B cells [33,34], and its constitutive expression has been reported to impair mouse B cell development [35].
('5', 'Positive_regulation', 'Id1')

However, BMP-6 did not induce significant changes in the protein expression of Id2 and Id3.
('BMP-6', 'Gene_expression', 'Id2')

The antiproliferative and death inducing effect of BMP-6 in B cells with concomitant upregulation of Id1 protein is therefore in line with the view that Id proteins are required for the induction of growth arrest and apoptosis in B-lymphocyte progenitors by TGF-beta [40].
('BMP-6', 'Positive_regulation', 'Id1')

In this respect, it is of interest that targeted expression of Id1 to B-lymphocytes resulted in aberrant B cell development, massive apoptosis, and subsequent development of B cell lymphomas [35].
('5', 'Positive_regulation', 'Id1')

Moreover, BMP-6 has been suggested to play a role in rheumatoid arthritis (RA) [43,44] and elevated levels of Id1 and Id3 have been found in the synovia of RA-patients [45].
('5', 'Positive_regulation', 'Id1'),('BMP-6', 'Positive_regulation', 'Id1')

RFLAT-1: a new zinc finger transcription factor that activates RANTES gene expression in T lymphocytes.
('RFLAT-1', 'Gene_expression', 'RANTES')

Using expression cloning, we identified the first "late" T lymphocyte associated transcription factor and named it "RANTES Factor of Late Activated T Lymphocytes-1" (RFLAT-1).
('RFLAT-1', 'Gene_expression', 'RANTES')

RFLAT-1 is a novel, phosphorylated, zinc finger transcription factor that is expressed in T cells 3 days after activation, coincident with RANTES expression.
('RFLAT-1', 'Gene_expression', 'RANTES')

While Rel proteins play the dominant role in RANTES gene expression in fibroblasts, RFLAT-1 is a strong transactivator for RANTES in T cells.
('RFLAT-1', 'Gene_expression', 'RANTES')

The CD4+CD25-, CD45RA+, CD45RO+, and CD4+CD45RO+CD25- were able to significantly induce FOXP3 mRNA up to 30-fold upon TCR activation and addition of TGF-beta.
('TGF-beta', 'Gene_expression', 'FOXP3')

Th2 cells are known to produce IL-4 upon activation, which may interact with TGF-beta signaling and thus prevent FOXP3 induction.
('TGF-beta', 'Gene_expression', 'FOXP3'),('IL-4', 'Positive_regulation', 'FOXP3'),('IL-4', 'Gene_expression', 'FOXP3')

However, the neutralization of IL-4 with a blocking IL-4 antibody did not rescue FOXP3 expression in the differentiated Th2 cells (unpublished data).
('IL-4', 'Positive_regulation', 'FOXP3'),('IL-4', 'Gene_expression', 'FOXP3')

Repeated exposure to TGF-beta did not further increase the FOXP3 expression in the iTreg lineage but transiently induced FOXP3 expression in Th1 cells.
('TGF-beta', 'Gene_expression', 'FOXP3')

Naturally occurring Th2 cells such as CRTH2+ T cells, T cells isolated according to their IL-4 secretion, or an IL-4-producing T cell clone (BR8) were also lacking FOXP3 expression (Figure 2B).
('IL-4', 'Positive_regulation', 'FOXP3'),('IL-4', 'Gene_expression', 'FOXP3')

Furthermore TGF-beta-mediated FOXP3 induction failed in these cells in contrast to the naive T cells (Figure 2B).
('TGF-beta', 'Gene_expression', 'FOXP3')

Because IL-4 is the key Th2 cytokine, the expression of IL-4 and FOXP3 in freshly isolated CD4+ T cells was analyzed by fluorescence activated cell sorting (FACS).
('IL-4', 'Positive_regulation', 'FOXP3'),('IL-4', 'Gene_expression', 'FOXP3')

IL-4-expressing cells were most abundant among CD45RO+CD25- cells, which did not co-express FOXP3 (Figure 3A, left panel).
('IL-4', 'Positive_regulation', 'FOXP3'),('IL-4', 'Gene_expression', 'FOXP3')

In contrast, CD45RO+CD25+ cells abundantly expressed FOXP3, while lacking IL-4 (Figure 3A, right panel).
('IL-4', 'Positive_regulation', 'FOXP3'),('IL-4', 'Gene_expression', 'FOXP3')

As shown in Figure 3B, the frequency of the IL-4+ cells was always below 1% in the FOXP3+ cells close to the background.
('IL-4', 'Positive_regulation', 'FOXP3'),('IL-4', 'Gene_expression', 'FOXP3')

The IL-4+ cells were confined to the FOXP3- cells, as shown for the CD45RO+CD25-, CD45RO+CD25+, and CD45RO+CD25+high cells (Figure 3B).
('IL-4', 'Positive_regulation', 'FOXP3'),('IL-4', 'Gene_expression', 'FOXP3')

Cells enriched for their IL-4 secretion using the magnetic cell isolation technology contained some FOXP3-expressing cells, but importantly, the expression did not overlap.
('IL-4', 'Positive_regulation', 'FOXP3'),('IL-4', 'Gene_expression', 'FOXP3')

The role of p16 in the E2F-dependent thymidine kinase regulation.
('p16', 'Regulation', 'thymidine kinase')

Phosphorylation of the retinoblastoma protein by cyclin-dependent kinases 4 and 6 prevents its interaction with the transcription factor E2F, which subsequently promotes the expression of S phase regulated genes, such as thymidine kinase.
('6', 'Phosphorylation', 'retinoblastoma protein'),('cyclin-dependent kinases 4', 'Phosphorylation', 'retinoblastoma protein')

We investigated the regulation of thymidine kinase in phytohemagglutinin-stimulated normal human lymphocytes and in the p16-negative human acute lymphoblastic leukemia cell lines, MOLT-4 and CEM.
('p16', 'Regulation', 'thymidine kinase')

Transient expression of p16 in normal human lymphocytes caused arrest in G1, but was without effect on the cell growth of MOLT-4 and CEM cells, although all of them express functional retinoblastoma protein.
('6', 'Phosphorylation', 'retinoblastoma protein')

Nevertheless, in the two leukemia cell lines transient overexpression of p16 reestablished the normal regulation of thymidine kinase, paralleled by an increase of the underphosphorylated form of retinoblastoma protein and decrease of free E2F bound to its motif in the thymidine kinase promoter.
('6', 'Phosphorylation', 'retinoblastoma protein'),('p16', 'Regulation', 'thymidine kinase')

We demonstrate that loss of p16 causes upregulation of this DNA precursor pathway enzyme via activation of E2F by a mechanism involving retinoblastoma protein.
('6', 'Phosphorylation', 'retinoblastoma protein')

Triggering of HLA class II antigens by the anti-HLA-DR monoclonal antibody (mAb) L243 significantly (P < 0.05) and differentially enhanced the release of tumor necrosis factor alpha (TNF-alpha) by the non-Hodgkin's lymphoma cells Ri-I, Ci-I, and Sc-I, which are at a distinct stage of B-cell differentiation, and by the more mature Burkitt lymphoma cell Raji; in contrast, it did not induce TNF-alpha release by the pre-B leukemia cells Nalm-6 and BV173.
('TNF-alpha', 'Localization', 'TNF-alpha')

TNF-alpha release peaked at 24 h and decreased thereafter, and it was dose dependent and preceded by an increase of TNF-alpha mRNA detectable after 3 h of stimulation with mAb L243.
('TNF-alpha', 'Localization', 'TNF-alpha')

Secreted TNF-alpha mediated the enhancement of nuclear factor kappa B (NF-kappa B) and activator protein-1 (AP-1) binding activity; in fact, the triggering of HLA-DR antigens in the presence of antihuman TNF-alpha-neutralizing antibodies did not upregulate NF-kappa B and AP-1.
('TNF-alpha', 'Localization', 'TNF-alpha')

Altogether, our data demonstrate that: (a) the ability of B cells to release TNF-alpha after triggering of HLA-DR antigens depends on their stage of differentiation; (b) levels of released TNF-alpha seem to correlate with the stage of B-cell maturation but do not correlate with the amounts of cell surface HLA-DR antigens; (c) secreted TNF-alpha regulates the levels of expression of NF-kappa B and AP-1 by an autocrine loop; and (d) intracellular signals mediating TNF-alpha release by B cells are distinct from those regulating homotypic aggregation and proliferation.
('TNF-alpha', 'Localization', 'TNF-alpha')

By using Jurkat and primary human T lymphocytes, we demonstrate that the simultaneous activation of two second messengers of the TCR-initiated signal transduction, protein kinase C (PKC) and calcineurin, results in the synergistic activation of the IkappaBalpha kinase (IKK) complex but not of another putative IkappaBalpha kinase, p90(rsk).
('p90(rsk)', 'Phosphorylation', 'IkappaBalpha')

We also demonstrate that the IKK complex, but not p90(rsk), is responsible for the in vivo phosphorylation of IkappaBalpha mediated by the co-activation of PKC and calcineurin.
('p90(rsk)', 'Phosphorylation', 'IkappaBalpha')

Tat counteracts the IkappaB-alpha inhibition of p65 by competing the repressor binding
('Tat', 'Binding', 'IkappaB-alpha'),('IkappaB-alpha', 'Binding', 'p65')

We further investigated the physical interaction of Tat with IkappaB-alpha using in vitro translated proteins in coimmunoprecipitation assays.
('Tat', 'Binding', 'IkappaB-alpha')

For mapping the interaction domains, we used the following Tat mutants: Tat T,N(23,24)A, Tat C(22,25,27)A, Tat K(50,51)A and Tat R(49-57)A (Figure 3A).
('Tat', 'Binding', 'Tat')

IkappaB-alpha coimmunoprecipitated with all Tat proteins, except Tat R(49-57)A (Figure 3B).
('Tat', 'Binding', 'IkappaB-alpha'),('Tat R(49-57)A', 'Binding', 'IkappaB-alpha'),('Tat', 'Binding', 'Tat')

These results indicated that the arginine-rich domain of Tat was involved in the binding to IkappaB-alpha, which was consistent with previous observations (50,51).
('Tat', 'Binding', 'IkappaB-alpha')

Moreover, Tat associating with IkappaB-alpha competed the binding of IkappaB-alpha to p65 in a dose-dependent manner (Figure 3C, lanes 3-5), while Tat R(49-57)A, which lacked the binding site for IkappaB-alpha, did not associate with IkappaB-alpha and did not compete the binding of IkappaB-alpha to p65 (Figure 3C, lanes 6-8).
('Tat', 'Binding', 'IkappaB-alpha'),('Tat R(49-57)A', 'Binding', 'IkappaB-alpha'),('IkappaB-alpha', 'Binding', 'p65'),('Tat', 'Binding', 'Tat')

Next, we evaluated whether Tat counteracted the IkappaB-alpha-mediated inhibition of p65 binding to DNA by incubating in vitro translated p65 and IkappaB-alpha proteins with the NF-kappaB probe in presence or absence of Tat followed by EMSA.
('Tat', 'Binding', 'IkappaB-alpha'),('IkappaB-alpha', 'Binding', 'p65'),('Tat', 'Binding', 'Tat')

The p65 DNA binding activity was inhibited by IkappaB-alpha and restored in a dose-dependent manner by wild-type Tat, and not by Tat R(49-57) (Figure 3D).
('Tat', 'Binding', 'IkappaB-alpha'),('IkappaB-alpha', 'Binding', 'p65'),('Tat', 'Binding', 'Tat')

Further, we analysed the Tat effect on the IkappaB-alpha repression of p65 transcriptional activity by transfecting p50-/-p65-/-MEFs with the NF-kappaB-Luc reporter together with expression vectors of p65 and IkappaB-alpha, in presence or absence of Tat.
('Tat', 'Binding', 'IkappaB-alpha'),('IkappaB-alpha', 'Binding', 'p65'),('Tat', 'Binding', 'Tat')

IkappaB-alpha inhibited the p65-dependent expression of the luciferase gene, which was restored in a dose-dependent manner by wild-type Tat, and not by Tat R(49-57)A (Figure 3E).
('Tat', 'Binding', 'IkappaB-alpha'),('p65', 'Gene_expression', 'luciferase'),('Tat R(49-57)A', 'Binding', 'IkappaB-alpha'),('IkappaB-alpha', 'Binding', 'p65'),('Tat', 'Binding', 'Tat')

Altogether these results indicated that Tat counteracts the IkappaB-alpha repression of the p65 DNA-binding and transcriptional activity by associating with IkappaB-alpha and competing the repressor binding to p65.
('Tat', 'Binding', 'IkappaB-alpha'),('IkappaB-alpha', 'Binding', 'p65')

In both T cells and HeLa cells HIV-1 Tat suppressed the expression of Mn-dependent superoxide dismutase (Mn-SOD), a mitochondrial enzyme that is part of the cellular defense system against oxidative stress.
('Tat', 'Transcription', 'Mn-SOD'),('Tat', 'Gene_expression', 'Mn-SOD')

Thus, Mn-SOD RNA protein levels and activity were markedly reduced in the presence of Tat.
('Tat', 'Transcription', 'Mn-SOD'),('Tat', 'Gene_expression', 'Mn-SOD')

A truncated Tat protein (Tat1-72), known to transactivate the HIV-1 long terminal repeat (LTR), no longer affected Mn-SOD expression, the cellular redox state or TNF-mediated cytotoxicity.
('Tat', 'Transcription', 'Mn-SOD'),('Tat', 'Gene_expression', 'Mn-SOD')

Thus, our experiments demonstrate that the C-terminal region of HIV-1 Tat is required to suppress Mn-SOD expression and to induce pro-oxidative conditions reflected by a drop in reduced glutathione (GSH) and the GSH:oxidized GSH (GSSG) ratio.
('Tat', 'Transcription', 'Mn-SOD'),('Tat', 'Gene_expression', 'Mn-SOD')

('IBR', 'Transcription', 'histone h5')

In co-transfection experiments, the galectin-3 promoter was significantly up-regulated by expression vectors encoding the 40-kd Tax protein, a potent transactivator in HTLV-I.
('Tax', 'Localization', 'galectin-3'),('Tax', 'Transcription', 'galectin-3')

Analysis of various Tax mutants suggested that galectin-3 promoter induction is dependent on activation of the cyclic-AMP-responsive element binding protein/activation transcription factor family of transcription factors and, to a lesser extent, nuclear factor-kappa B/Rel induction.
('Tax', 'Localization', 'galectin-3'),('Tax', 'Transcription', 'galectin-3')

Transfection of human promonocytic U-937 cells with an HTLV-I Tax expression vector induced galectin-3 expression in this cell line.
('Tax', 'Localization', 'galectin-3'),('Tax', 'Transcription', 'galectin-3')

Functionally, galectin-3 was shown to activate interleukin-2 production in Jurkat T cells.
('galectin-3', 'Gene_expression', 'interleukin-2')

Together, these findings raise the possibility that HTLV-I Tax production induces the transcription and subsequent synthesis and secretion of galectin-3, which in turn may further activate these T cells and contribute to the altered properties of cell growth found in adult T cell leukemia induced by HTLV-I.
('Tax', 'Localization', 'galectin-3'),('Tax', 'Transcription', 'galectin-3')

Cell specific expression of human Bruton's agammaglobulinemia tyrosine kinase gene (Btk) is regulated by Sp1- and Spi-1/PU.1-family members.
('Sp1', 'Gene_expression', 'Btk'),('PU.1', 'Gene_expression', 'Btk'),('Spi-1', 'Gene_expression', 'Btk')

In the erythroleukemia cell line K562, due to the absence of Spi-B, only PU.1 bound to the Btk promoter.
('PU.1', 'Gene_expression', 'Btk'),('Spi-B', 'Gene_expression', 'Btk')

In addition Spi-B as well as PU.1 were able to transactivate Btk expression.
('PU.1', 'Gene_expression', 'Btk'),('Spi-B', 'Gene_expression', 'Btk')

In fetal liver of PU.1-/- mice, which lack lymphoid and myeloid cells, expression of Btk was reduced two- to threefold but not abolished.
('PU.1', 'Gene_expression', 'Btk')

Collectively this study shows that expression of the Btk gene is regulated by the combined action of Sp1- and PU.1-family members.
('Sp1', 'Gene_expression', 'Btk'),('PU.1', 'Gene_expression', 'Btk')
