The participation of STAT4 in the regulation of IRF-1 was demonstrated in two ways.
('STAT4', 'Regulation', 'IRF-1')

First, STAT4 was required for the IL-12-dependent transactivation of an IRF-1 reporter construct, and second, STAT4 binding to the IRF-1 promoter was shown using EMSA.
('STAT4', 'Regulation', 'IRF-1')

In contrast to IL-12, no up-regulation of IRF-1 was found in IL-4-stimulated cells, and IL-4 did not block IL-12-dependent up-regulation of IRF-1.
('IL-4', 'Positive_regulation', 'IRF-1')

Stat3gamma is derived from Stat3alpha by limited proteolysis and lacks the carboxyl-terminal portion of Stat3alpha.
('Stat3alpha', 'Positive_regulation', 'Stat3gamma')

Because this region of Stat3alpha is involved in transcriptional activation, our findings suggest the possibility that Stat3gamma may be transcriptionally inactive and may compete with Stat3alpha for Stat3 binding sites in these terminally differentiated myeloid cells.
('Stat3alpha', 'Positive_regulation', 'Stat3gamma')

Treatment of T cells with the selective PKC inhibitor GF109203X abrogates the PMA-induced IkB alpha phosphorylation/degradation irrespective of activation of Ca(2+)-dependent pathways, but not the phosphorylation and degradation of IkB alpha induced by TNF-alpha, a PKC-independent stimulus.
('TNF-alpha', 'Phosphorylation', 'IkB alpha'),('TNF-alpha', 'Protein_catabolism', 'IkB alpha')

Contrary to the interaction with PKC, Ca(2+)-dependent pathways synergize with TNF-alpha not at the level of IkB alpha phosphorylation, but at the level of its degradation.
('TNF-alpha', 'Phosphorylation', 'IkB alpha'),('TNF-alpha', 'Protein_catabolism', 'IkB alpha')

Triggering of complement receptors CR1 (CD35) and CR3 (CD11b/CD18) induces nuclear translocation of NF-kappa B (p50/p65) in human monocytes and enhances viral replication in HIV-infected monocytic cells.
('CR1', 'Localization', 'p50'),('CD35', 'Localization', 'p65'),('CD18', 'Localization', 'p65'),('CD35', 'Localization', 'p50'),('CD11b', 'Localization', 'p65'),('CR1', 'Localization', 'p65'),('CD18', 'Localization', 'p50'),('CD11b', 'Localization', 'p50')

('TNF-alpha', 'Positive_regulation', 'p65'),('TNF-alpha', 'Localization', 'p50'),('TNF-alpha', 'Positive_regulation', 'p50'),('TNF-alpha', 'Localization', 'p65')

Stimulation of CR1 or CR3 induces a two- to fourfold increase in the amount of cell-associated and released p24 Ag in cell cultures that was equivalent to that observed in control cultures triggered with LPS.

('CR1', 'Localization', 'p50'),('CR1', 'Localization', 'p65')

Uncoupling activation-dependent HS1 phosphorylation from nuclear factor of activated T cells transcriptional activation in Jurkat T cells: differential signaling through CD3 and the costimulatory receptors CD2 and CD28.
('CD2', 'Phosphorylation', 'HS1'),('CD28', 'Phosphorylation', 'HS1')

We have examined changes in HS1 phosphorylation after differential stimulation of CD3, CD2, and CD28 to elucidate its role in T cells and to further delineate the signaling pathways recruited by these receptors.
('CD2', 'Phosphorylation', 'HS1'),('CD28', 'Phosphorylation', 'HS1')

Unlike ligation of CD3, stimulation with anti-CD28 mAb or CHO cells expressing the CD28 ligands CD80 or CD86 did not lead to tyrosine phosphorylation of HS1 in Jurkat T cells.
('CD2', 'Phosphorylation', 'HS1'),('CD28', 'Phosphorylation', 'HS1')

Additionally, no tyrosine phosphorylation of HS1 was induced by mitogenic pairs of anti-CD2 mAbs capable of activating the transcription factor NFAT (nuclear factor of activated T cells).
('CD2', 'Phosphorylation', 'HS1')

Costimulation through CD28 and/or CD2 did not modulate the CD3-dependent phosphorylation of HS1.
('CD2', 'Phosphorylation', 'HS1'),('CD28', 'Phosphorylation', 'HS1')

Thus, although CD3, CD28, and CD2 activate many of the same signaling molecules, they differed in their capacity to induce the tyrosine phosphorylation of HSI.
('CD28', 'Phosphorylation', 'HSI'),('CD2', 'Phosphorylation', 'HSI')

During Epstein-Barr virus latent infection of B lymphocytes in vitro, six viral nuclear antigens (EBNAs) are expressed from one of two promoters, Cp or Wp, whose activities are mutually exclusive.
('Cp', 'Positive_regulation', 'Wp')

Upon infection, Wp is initially active, followed by a switch to Cp for the duration of latency.
('Cp', 'Positive_regulation', 'Wp')

It was determined that oriP, the origin for episomal maintenance during latency, is essential for efficient transcription initiation from either Cp or Wp in LCLs, as well as in some Burkitt's lymphoma cell lines.
('Cp', 'Positive_regulation', 'Wp')

In general, deletions which diminished Cp activity resulted in induction of Wp activity, consistent with suppression of Wp activity by transcriptional interference from Cp.
('Cp', 'Positive_regulation', 'Wp')

Furthermore, our studies showed association of the IKK-alpha/beta heterodimer with NIK, IkappaB-alpha and -epsilon in unstimulated cells.
('NIK', 'Phosphorylation', 'IkappaB-alpha')

Exposure to LPS or TNF led to differential patterns of IkappaB-alpha and IkappaB-epsilon disappearance from and reassembly with the signalsome, whereas IKK-alpha, IKK-beta, and NIK remained complex-associated.
('NIK', 'Phosphorylation', 'IkappaB-alpha')

NIK cannot phosphorylate IkappaB-alpha directly, but it appears to be a functionally important subunit, because mutated NIK inhibited stimulus-induced kappaB-dependent transcription more effectively than mutated IKK-alpha or -beta.
('NIK', 'Phosphorylation', 'IkappaB-alpha')

IL-2 gene expression and NF-kappa B activation through CD28 requires reactive oxygen production by 5-lipoxygenase.
('CD28', 'Gene_expression', 'IL-2')

Activation of the CD28 surface receptor provides a major costimulatory signal for T cell activation resulting in enhanced production of interleukin-2 (IL-2) and cell proliferation.
('CD28', 'Gene_expression', 'IL-2')

In primary T lymphocytes we show that CD28 ligation leads to the rapid intracellular formation of reactive oxygen intermediates (ROIs) which are required for CD28-mediated activation of the NF-kappa B/CD28-responsive complex and IL-2 expression.
('CD28', 'Gene_expression', 'IL-2')

('PKD1', 'Phosphorylation', 'HSP27')

We initially investigated the regulation of HSP27 phosphorylation in single knockout DT40 B cells lacking either PKD1 or PKD3.

('PKD1', 'Phosphorylation', 'HSP27'),('PKD3', 'Phosphorylation', 'HSP27')

However, BCR- and phorbol ester-induced phosphorylation of HSP27 on S82 was abolished in B cells that lacked both PKD1 and PKD3 (Fig.
('PKD1', 'Phosphorylation', 'HSP27'),('PKD3', 'Phosphorylation', 'HSP27')

('PKD3', 'Phosphorylation', 'HSP27')

In contrast, expression of a kinase-deficient PKD3 mutant protein in the double knockout cells was not able to restore BCR- or phorbol ester-induced HSP27 phosphorylation (Fig.
('PKD3', 'Phosphorylation', 'HSP27')

Hence, PKD3 as well as PKD1 can regulate HSP27 phosphorylation and in DT40 B cells they are functionally redundant as HSP27 kinases.
('PKD1', 'Phosphorylation', 'HSP27'),('PKD3', 'Phosphorylation', 'HSP27')

A dimerization cofactor of HNF-1 alpha (DCoH) was identified that displayed a restricted tissue distribution and did not bind to DNA, but, rather, selectively stabilized HNF-1 alpha dimers.
('DCoH', 'Binding', 'HNF-1 alpha')

The formation of a stable tetrameric DCoH-HNF-1 alpha complex, which required the dimerization domain of HNF-1 alpha, did not change the DNA binding characteristics of HNF-1 alpha, but enhanced its transcriptional activity.
('DCoH', 'Binding', 'HNF-1 alpha')

IKKbeta is required for RPS3 nuclear translocation
('IKKbeta', 'Localization', 'RPS3')

To examine whether the RPS3-IKKbeta interaction is required for RPS3 nuclear translocation, we knocked down IKKalpha or IKKbeta expression with siRNAs (Supplementary Fig.
('IKKbeta', 'Localization', 'RPS3'),('RPS3', 'Localization', 'RPS3'),('IKKalpha', 'Localization', 'RPS3')

RPS3 nuclear translocation was only slightly, if at all, impaired by IKKalpha-silencing.
('IKKalpha', 'Localization', 'RPS3')

Conversely, knockdown of IKKbeta attenuated 60-70% of RPS3 nuclear accumulation following stimulation (Fig.
('IKKbeta', 'Localization', 'RPS3')

Immunoblotting of nuclear fractions confirmed that full expression of IKKbeta, but not IKKalpha, was necessary for activation-induced RPS3 nuclear translocation (Fig.
('IKKbeta', 'Localization', 'RPS3'),('IKKalpha', 'Localization', 'RPS3')

We next examined the nuclear translocation of RPS3 in cells ectopically expressing either kinase-dead (SSAA) or constitutively-active (SSEE) mutant IKKbeta proteins.
('IKKbeta', 'Localization', 'RPS3')

As expected, the SSEE, but not SSAA, mutant of IKKbeta induced NF-kappaB-dependent luciferase reporter activity (Fig.
('IKKbeta', 'Regulation', 'luciferase')

Whereas RPS3 remained cytosolic in IKKbeta (SSAA)-expressing cells (Fig.
('IKKbeta', 'Localization', 'RPS3')

2c, right), a substantial proportion of RPS3 translocated to the nucleus in cells expressing IKKbeta (SSEE) (Fig.
('IKKbeta', 'Localization', 'RPS3')

The percentage of cells containing detectable nuclear RPS3 increased 5-fold in IKKbeta (SSEE)-expressing cells, but not in IKKbeta (SSAA)-expressing ones (Fig.
('IKKbeta', 'Localization', 'RPS3')

Thus, IKKbeta activity is necessary and sufficient for RPS3 nuclear translocation in response to NF-kappaB activating stimuli.
('IKKbeta', 'Localization', 'RPS3')

In combination, EBF and E47 induce efficient expression of the endogenous immunoglobulin surrogate light chain genes, lambda5 and VpreB, whereas other pre-B cell-specific genes remain silent.
('E47', 'Gene_expression', 'lambda5'),('EBF', 'Gene_expression', 'VpreB'),('E47', 'Gene_expression', 'VpreB'),('EBF', 'Gene_expression', 'lambda5')

Multiple functionally important EBF and E47 binding sites were identified in the lambda5 promoter/enhancer region, indicating that lambda5 is a direct genetic target for these transcription factors.
('E47', 'Gene_expression', 'lambda5'),('EBF', 'Gene_expression', 'lambda5')

Expression of the IgG Fc receptor type I (Fc gamma RI) on myeloid cells is dramatically increased by treatment with interferon-gamma (IFN-gamma).
('IFN-gamma', 'Transcription', 'Fc gamma RI')

We observed that Fc gamma RI transcript levels in monoblast-like U937 cells were elevated within 3 hr and peaked 12 hr after exposure to IFN-gamma.
('IFN-gamma', 'Transcription', 'Fc gamma RI')

Treatment of U937 with IFN-gamma for 9 hr in the presence of cycloheximide led to super-induction of Fc gamma RI expression.
('IFN-gamma', 'Transcription', 'Fc gamma RI')

Nuclear run-on analysis revealed that the rate of Fc gamma RI transcription was increased by IFN-gamma.
('IFN-gamma', 'Transcription', 'Fc gamma RI')

Transient transfections of CAT reporter gene constructs containing various Fc gamma RIC promoter sequences into U937 cells revealed that a 20-bp region surrounding the transcription start site (-7 to +13) was capable of mediating transcription initiation and that an IFN-gamma responsive element (GIRE) was present within 74 bp upstream of the transcription initiation site.
('IFN-gamma', 'Transcription', 'Fc gamma RI')

Gel shift experiments further showed that the STAT1 alpha protein bound to the Fc gamma RIC GIRE in response to IFN-gamma treatment of U937 cells.
('IFN-gamma', 'Transcription', 'Fc gamma RI'),('STAT1 alpha', 'Regulation', 'Fc gamma RIC')

The Fc gamma RIC GIRE is homologous to the IFN-gamma activation sequence (GAS) of the guanylate binding protein and to X box elements of class II MHC genes.
('IFN-gamma', 'Transcription', 'Fc gamma RI')

Our results demonstrate that transcriptional regulation of the Fc gamma RIC gene by IFN-gamma involves the binding of STAT1 alpha to a 17-bp GAS homology in the proximal promoter.
('IFN-gamma', 'Transcription', 'Fc gamma RI'),('STAT1 alpha', 'Regulation', 'Fc gamma RIC')

Steel factor affects SCL expression during normal erythroid differentiation.
('Steel factor', 'Gene_expression', 'SCL'),('Steel factor', 'Transcription', 'SCL')

Steel factor is one of the growth factors that controls the proliferation and differentiation of hematopoietic cells and SCL, also known as Tcl-5 or Tal-1, is a transcription factor involved in erythropoiesis.
('Steel factor', 'Gene_expression', 'SCL'),('Steel factor', 'Transcription', 'SCL')

In this report, we studied the role of SCL in the proliferation of human peripheral blood burst-forming unit-erythroid (BFU-E) and the effects of Steel factor on SCL expression in proliferating erythroid cells.
('Steel factor', 'Gene_expression', 'SCL'),('Steel factor', 'Transcription', 'SCL')

The role of SCL in Steel factor-induced erythroid proliferation was then examined.
('Steel factor', 'Gene_expression', 'SCL'),('Steel factor', 'Transcription', 'SCL')

In day 7 and day 10 erythroid precursors cultured with Steel factor, SCL protein was increased significantly compared to control.
('Steel factor', 'Gene_expression', 'SCL'),('Steel factor', 'Transcription', 'SCL')

The increase in SCL protein levels in early erythroid precursors stimulated with Steel factor suggests one mechanism through which Steel factor may enhance normal erythroid proliferation.
('Steel factor', 'Gene_expression', 'SCL'),('Steel factor', 'Transcription', 'SCL')

SCL mRNA levels assessed by Northern blot in day 7 cells did not increase significantly in response to Steel factor stimulation, suggesting that posttranscriptional mechanisms may also be important in the increase in SCL protein observed in response to Steel.
('Steel factor', 'Gene_expression', 'SCL'),('Steel factor', 'Transcription', 'SCL')

In addition, we observed that the A3G promoter was not inducible by IFN-alpha or IFN-gamma in A3.01 T cells, whereas in the hepatic cell line HepG2, a moderate induction was measured.
('IFN-alpha', 'Gene_expression', 'A3G'),('IFN-gamma', 'Gene_expression', 'A3G')

A recent study found no influence of IFN-alpha or IFN-gamma on A3G expression in resting primary blood lymphocytes (52).
('IFN-alpha', 'Gene_expression', 'A3G'),('IFN-gamma', 'Gene_expression', 'A3G')

Another publication describes an enhanced expression of A3G after IFN-alpha treatment in resting primary CD4 T cells, but not in activated T cells (53).
('IFN-alpha', 'Gene_expression', 'A3G')

The HIV-1 Vif protein is neutralizing the antiviral function of A3G by a multitude of ways.
('Vif', 'Protein_catabolism', 'A3G'),('Vif', 'Transcription', 'A3G')

There is evidence that Vif also promotes exclusion of A3G from the virus particles and an influence on the A3G translation process is discussed (8,42,43).
('A3G', 'Binding', 'A3G'),('A3G', 'Transcription', 'A3G'),('Vif', 'Protein_catabolism', 'A3G'),('Vif', 'Transcription', 'A3G')

The question whether Vif alters transcription controlled by the A3G promoter has not been analyzed so far.
('Vif', 'Protein_catabolism', 'A3G'),('Vif', 'Transcription', 'A3G')

Our analysis indicates that transcription from the A3G promoter is unaffected by Vif or other HIV-1 proteins.
('Vif', 'Protein_catabolism', 'A3G'),('Vif', 'Transcription', 'A3G')

This observation is consistent with the results of the 5'-RACE, since Sp1 is known to play an important role for RNA polymerase II to bind to the transcription initiation site in TATA-boxless promoters and is associated with multiple transcription initiation sites (54-56).
('Sp1', 'Binding', 'RNA polymerase II')

Therefore, Sp1/Sp3 transcription factors are most likely also mediating basal transcription of the A3F gene.
('Sp1', 'Transcription', 'A3F'),('Sp3', 'Transcription', 'A3F')

Nuclear factor of activated T cells and AP-1 are insufficient for IL-2 promoter activation: requirement for CD28 up-regulation of RE/AP.
('CD28', 'Positive_regulation', 'IL-2')

IL-2 promoter activation in Jurkat T cells stimulated with superantigen presented by Raji B cells requires CD28 activation.
('CD28', 'Positive_regulation', 'IL-2')

The addition of rCTLA4Ig, which blocks CD28 binding to its ligand, to the cultures decreased IL-2 promoter activation by >80%.
('CD28', 'Positive_regulation', 'IL-2')

Thus, the requirement for CD28 in IL-2 promoter activation appears to be due to RE/AP and not the NFAT or AP-1 sites.
('CD28', 'Positive_regulation', 'IL-2')

Thus, c-Fos/c-Jun heterodimers might contribute to the repression of DRA gene expression.
('c-Jun', 'Gene_expression', 'DRA'),('c-Fos', 'Gene_expression', 'DRA')

BMP-6 induces phosphorylation of Smad1/5/8
('BMP-6', 'Phosphorylation', 'Smad1'),('BMP-6', 'Phosphorylation', '5'),('BMP-6', 'Phosphorylation', '8')

Interestingly, treatment with 500 ng/ml BMP-6 induced phosphorylation of Smad.
('BMP-6', 'Phosphorylation', '5')

The BMP-6 induced phosphorylation was high at the earliest time point tested (15 minutes), and remained high for at least 48 hours (Figure 5).
('BMP-6', 'Phosphorylation', '5'),('BMP-6', 'Phosphorylation', '8')

The current study provides evidence that GATA3 and FOXP3 play a competitive role in iTreg cell commitment as T-bet and GATA3 for Th1 and Th2 differentiation, respectively.
('GATA3', 'Positive_regulation', 'FOXP3')

We show that GATA3 inhibits FOXP3 induction and that IL-4 limits FOXP3 expression in a GATA3-mediated way, both in vitro and in vivo.
('GATA3', 'Positive_regulation', 'FOXP3'),('IL-4', 'Gene_expression', 'FOXP3')

We also show that GATA3 directly binds to the FOXP3 promoter and thereby prevents the induction of this gene, demonstrating that Th2 differentiation overrules iTreg induction.
('GATA3', 'Positive_regulation', 'FOXP3')

Stimulation of T cells with BW 828 induced an increase in intracellular Ca2+, but did not lead to detectable activation of the protein kinases p56(lck) and c-Raf-1.
('BW 828', 'Positive_regulation', 'p56(lck)')

On the other hand, stimulation of T cells with mAb 9.3 increased the level of intracellular Ca2+ and triggered the activation of p56(lck) and c-Raf-1, but was unable to induce the binding of transcription factors to the IL-2 promoter.
('9.3', 'Positive_regulation', 'p56(lck)')

In contrast to the differential signaling of BW 828 and 9.3 in resting T cells, the two mAbs exhibited a similar pattern of early signaling events in activated T cells and Jurkat cells (p56(lck) activation, association of phosphatidylinositol 3-kinase with CD28), indicating that the signaling capacity of CD28 changes with activation.
('9.3', 'Positive_regulation', 'p56(lck)'),('BW 828', 'Positive_regulation', 'p56(lck)')

CD4 and intracellular FOXP3 analysis by flow cytometry after 72 h. One of three independent experiments is shown.
('3', 'Gene_expression', 'FOXP3')

Analysis of the accumulation of mRNA-encoding members of the AP-1 transcription factor family demonstrated that c-fos and junB are also expressed upon stimulation of NK and T cells with IL-2, but not IL-12, whereas expression of c-jun and junD is not modified by either cytokine.
('IL-2', 'Gene_expression', 'c-jun'),('IL-2', 'Gene_expression', 'junD')

Analysis of the expression of genes reported to regulate cytokine-induced proliferation demonstrated that both IL-2 and IL-12 induce c-myc mRNA accumulation in NK and T cells, whereas only IL-2 induces bcl-2 expression.
('IL-2', 'Positive_regulation', 'c-myc'),('IL-2', 'Gene_expression', 'bcl-2')

Expression of the human interleukin-2 (IL-2) receptor alpha chain gene is potently upregulated by its own ligand, IL-2.
('IL-2', 'Gene_expression', 'interleukin-2 (IL-2) receptor alpha chain')

However, it was not possible to ascertain whether Bcl-2 upregulation was a specific consequence of LMP1 expression or an artifact of the selection procedure whereby rare Bcl-2+ cells already present in the starting population might best be able to tolerate the potentially toxic effects of LMP1.
('LMP1', 'Positive_regulation', 'Bcl-2')

We therefore reexamined this issue by using two different experimental approaches that allowed LMP1- induced effects to be monitored immediately following expression of the viral protein and in the absence of selective pressures; activation of the NF-kappa B transcription factor and upregulation of the cell adhesion molecule ICAM-1 were used as early indices of LMP1 function.
('LMP1', 'Positive_regulation', 'ICAM-1')

All six B-cell lines tested showed NF-kappa B activation in response to LMP1 expression, and this was followed in five of six lines by expression of ICAM-1 and Bcl-2.
('LMP1', 'Positive_regulation', 'Bcl-2'),('LMP1', 'Positive_regulation', 'ICAM-1')

We therefore conclude that Bcl-2 upregulation is part of the panoply of cellular changes induced by LMP1 but that the effect is cell type specific.
('LMP1', 'Positive_regulation', 'Bcl-2')

Luciferase assays revealed a approximately20-fold increased transcriptional activity of the 1025 bp sequence as compared to the empty vector, indicating that we had identified an active A3G promoter sequence (Figure 3B).
('A3G', 'Transcription', 'Luciferase')

The regulation of interleukin-2 receptor alpha chain (IL-2R alpha) expression and nuclear factor (NF) activation by protein kinase C (PKC) in resting T cells, has been studied.
('IL-2', 'Negative_regulation', 'IL-2R alpha')

Treatment of human resting T cells with phorbol esters strongly induced the expression of IL-2R alpha and the activation of NF.kappa B.
('IL-2', 'Negative_regulation', 'IL-2R alpha')

This activation was due to the translocation of p65 and c-Rel NF.kappa B proteins from cytoplasmic stores to the nucleus, where they bound the kappa B sequence of the IL-2R alpha promoter either as p50.p65 or as p50.c-Rel heterodimers.
('IL-2', 'Negative_regulation', 'IL-2R alpha')

Furthermore, cyclosporin A, which blocked TNF alpha production induced by PKC, strongly inhibited IL-2R alpha and NF.kappa B activation.
('TNF alpha', 'Negative_regulation', 'IL-2R alpha'),('IL-2', 'Negative_regulation', 'IL-2R alpha')

The addition of either TNF alpha or IL-2 partially recovered cyclosporin A-induced IL-2R alpha inhibition, but only TNF alpha completely recovered NF.kappa B activation.
('TNF alpha', 'Negative_regulation', 'IL-2R alpha'),('IL-2', 'Negative_regulation', 'IL-2R alpha')

Those results indicate that, in resting T cells, PKC activation has only a triggering role, whereas the endogenously secreted TNF alpha plays an essential role in the quantitative control of the expression of IL-2R alpha chain or NF.kappa B activation.
('TNF alpha', 'Negative_regulation', 'IL-2R alpha'),('IL-2', 'Negative_regulation', 'IL-2R alpha'),('TNF alpha', 'Gene_expression', 'IL-2R alpha chain')

Transcription factors RUNX1 and RUNX3 in the induction and suppressive function of Foxp3+inducible regulatory T cells
('RUNX3', 'Gene_expression', 'Foxp3')

In this study, we show that the transforming growth factor-beta (TGF-beta) induces the expression of the Runt-related transcription factors RUNX1 and RUNX3 in CD4+ T cells.
('TGF-beta', 'Gene_expression', 'RUNX3'),('TGF-beta', 'Gene_expression', 'RUNX1')

Inactivation of the gene encoding RUNX cofactor core-binding factor-beta (CBFbeta) in mice and small interfering RNA (siRNA)-mediated suppression of RUNX1 and RUNX3 in human T cells resulted in reduced expression of Foxp3.
('core-binding factor-beta', 'Gene_expression', 'Foxp3'),('RUNX3', 'Gene_expression', 'Foxp3')

Circulating human CD4+ CD25high CD127- T reg cells significantly expressed higher levels of RUNX3, FOXP3, and TGF-beta mRNA compared with CD4+CD25- cells.
('TGF-beta', 'Gene_expression', 'RUNX3')

These data demonstrate Runx transcription factors as a molecular link in TGF-beta-induced Foxp3 expression in iT reg cell differentiation and function.
('TGF-beta', 'Gene_expression', 'Foxp3')

Tpl-2 induces IL-2 expression in T-cell lines by triggering multiple signaling pathways that activate NFAT and NF-kappaB.
('Tpl-2', 'Gene_expression', 'IL-2')

The Tpl-2 kinase activates the nuclear factor of activated T cells (NFAT) and induces IL-2 expression in T-cell lines.
('Tpl-2', 'Gene_expression', 'IL-2')

Here we show that the activation of the IL-2 promoter by Tpl-2 is inhibited by mutant signaling molecules that inhibit the mitogen-activated protein kinase (MAPK) or the calcineurin/NFAT pathways and is promoted by combinations of signaling molecules that activate these pathways.
('Tpl-2', 'Gene_expression', 'IL-2')

We, therefore, conclude that signals generated by the convergence of the MAPK and the calcineurin/NFAT pathway are necessary and sufficient for the activation of the IL-2 promoter by Tpl-2.
('Tpl-2', 'Gene_expression', 'IL-2')

However, it was only the IL-2 promoter whose activation by Tpl-2 was fully blocked by the dominant negative mutant MEK1S218/222A and the MEK1/MEK2 inhibitor PD098059.
('Tpl-2', 'Gene_expression', 'IL-2')

While the activation of the IL-2 promoter and an NFAT-driven minimal promoter by Tpl-2 was fully blocked by the dominant negative mutant NFAT delta418, it was only partially blocked by the calcineurin inhibitor cyclosporin A suggesting that the Tpl-2-mediated NFAT activation is under the control of a combination of calcineurin-dependent and independent pathways.
('Tpl-2', 'Gene_expression', 'IL-2')

In HIV-1-infected monocytes Tat sustains the NF-kappaB activity and promotes the transcriptional activation of MIP-1alpha by interacting with IkappaB-alpha and p65
('p65', 'Gene_expression', 'MIP-1alpha'),('Tat', 'Binding', 'p65'),('Tat', 'Gene_expression', 'IkappaB-alpha'),('Tat', 'Binding', 'MIP-1alpha'),('Tat', 'Gene_expression', 'MIP-1alpha')

We next analysed whether Tat affected the NF-kappaB activity and the expression of MIP-1alpha in the course of HIV-1 infection.
('Tat', 'Binding', 'MIP-1alpha'),('Tat', 'Gene_expression', 'MIP-1alpha')

Cells were transfected with siRNA Tat, siRNA control or left untransfected to modulate the Tat expression, and then analysed for the kinetic of NF-kappaB activation following viral infection.
('siRNA Tat', 'Gene_expression', 'Tat')

The expression of Tat and p24 was detected at 3- to 12-h post-infection, while it was barely detected in siRNA Tat-transfected cells (Figure 6A).
('siRNA Tat', 'Gene_expression', 'Tat'),('siRNA Tat', 'Gene_expression', 'p24')

The NF-kappaB activity, as measured by p65 DNA binding, was induced at 3-h post-infection in both Tat-positive (no siRNA and siRNA control) and Tat-negative cells (siRNA Tat), and increased at 12 h only in Tat-positive cells (Figure 6B).
('siRNA Tat', 'Gene_expression', 'Tat'),('Tat', 'Binding', 'p65')

Degradation of IkappaB-alpha was observed at 3-h post-infection, and was followed by de novo synthesis of IkappaB-alpha at 12 h independently of the Tat presence (Figure 6C).
('IkappaB-alpha', 'Gene_expression', 'IkappaB-alpha'),('Tat', 'Gene_expression', 'IkappaB-alpha')

In HIV-1-infected U937 cells, the endogenous Tat was coimmunoprecipitated with IkappaB-alpha and p65 (Figure 6E), and activated the MIP-1alpha expression in a p65-dependent manner, as shown by the lack of effect following RNA interference of Tat or p65 (Figure 6F).
('p65', 'Gene_expression', 'MIP-1alpha'),('Tat', 'Binding', 'p65'),('Tat', 'Gene_expression', 'IkappaB-alpha'),('Tat', 'Binding', 'MIP-1alpha'),('Tat', 'Gene_expression', 'MIP-1alpha')

Moreover, Tat and p65 were both recruited to the NF-kappaB enhancer of MIP-1alpha, while the p65 occupancy was abolished by siRNA Tat (Figure 6G and H).
('p65', 'Gene_expression', 'MIP-1alpha'),('siRNA Tat', 'Gene_expression', 'Tat'),('Tat', 'Binding', 'p65'),('siRNA Tat', 'Binding', 'MIP-1alpha'),('Tat', 'Binding', 'MIP-1alpha'),('Tat', 'Gene_expression', 'MIP-1alpha')

Altogether these results indicated that in single round HIV-1 infection Tat associated with IkappaB-alpha and p65, and induced the p65-dependent activation of MIP-1alpha expression through occupancy of the MIP-1alpha promoter and increased recruitment of p65.
('p65', 'Gene_expression', 'MIP-1alpha'),('Tat', 'Binding', 'p65'),('Tat', 'Gene_expression', 'IkappaB-alpha'),('Tat', 'Binding', 'MIP-1alpha'),('Tat', 'Gene_expression', 'MIP-1alpha')

Interferon regulatory factor 2 (IRF-2) is a transcriptional regulatory protein that terminates interferon beta expression initiated by interferon regulatory factor 1.
('IRF-2', 'Gene_expression', 'interferon beta'),('interferon regulatory factor 1', 'Gene_expression', 'interferon beta'),('interferon regulatory factor 1', 'Transcription', 'IRF-2')

This region contains elements which are shared with the transcriptional enhancers of other genes including interferon regulatory factor 1, interferon beta, and interferon-inducible genes.
('interferon regulatory factor 1', 'Gene_expression', 'interferon beta')

These data suggest that interferon regulatory factor 1 not only triggers the activation of the interferon signal transduction pathway, but also may play a role in limiting the duration of this response by activating the transcription of IRF-2.
('interferon regulatory factor 1', 'Transcription', 'IRF-2')

Targeted degradation of c-Fos, but not v-Fos, by a phosphorylation-dependent signal on c-Jun.
('c-Jun', 'Protein_catabolism', 'c-Fos')

The proto-oncogene products c-Fos and c-Jun heterodimerize through their leucine zippers to form the AP-1 transcription factor.
('c-Jun', 'Protein_catabolism', 'c-Fos')

In transient expression and in vitro degradation experiments, the stability of c-Fos was decreased when the protein was dimerized with phosphorylated c-Jun.
('c-Jun', 'Protein_catabolism', 'c-Fos')

c-Jun protein isolated from phorbol ester-induced cells did not target c-Fos for degradation, which suggests that c-Fos is transiently stabilized after stimulation of cell growth.
('c-Fos', 'Negative_regulation', 'c-Fos'),('c-Jun', 'Protein_catabolism', 'c-Fos')

v-Fos protein, the retroviral counterpart of c-Fos, was not susceptible to degradation targeted by c-Jun.
('c-Jun', 'Protein_catabolism', 'c-Fos')

In HIV-1 infection Tat sustains the NF-kappaB activity and enhances the MIP-1alpha expression via interaction with IkappaB-alpha and p65.
('Tat', 'Gene_expression', 'MIP-1alpha')

Even though Cbfb-deficient CD4+ T cells had impaired induction of Foxp3 after stimulation with anti-CD3/28 mAbs and TGF-beta, sufficient numbers of Foxp3+ cells could be generated to permit analysis of their suppressive activity.
('Cbfb', 'Positive_regulation', 'Foxp3')

Purified naive CD4+ T cells from CbfbF/F CD4-cre and control CbfbF/+ CD4-cre mice (Cd45.2) harboring a Foxp3-ires-GFP allele (Bettelli et al., 2006) were stimulated in vitro with anti-CD3/28 mAbs, IL-2, and TGF-beta.
('Cbfb', 'Positive_regulation', 'Foxp3')

The suppression was significantly reduced when cells from CbfbF/F CD4-cre mice were used, demonstrating that TGF-beta-induced Runx complexes are important for the suppressive activity of Foxp3+ T reg cells (Fig.
('Cbfb', 'Positive_regulation', 'Foxp3')

Foxp3+ and Foxp3- cells generated from both CbfbF/F CD4-cre and control cells all displayed similar proliferation rates and cell death as measured by CFSE dilution and annexin V staining, respectively (Fig.
('Cbfb', 'Positive_regulation', 'Foxp3')

These results demonstrate the important role of RUNX1 and RUNX3 not only for the induction of FOXP3, but also for the suppressive capacity of iT reg cells both in humans and in mice.
('RUNX1', 'Gene_expression', 'FOXP3'),('RUNX3', 'Gene_expression', 'FOXP3')

In the suppression experiment with human cells, reduced suppressive activity was caused by reduced FOXP3 expression in T cells by siRNA inhibition of RUNX1 and RUNX3.
('RUNX1', 'Gene_expression', 'FOXP3'),('RUNX3', 'Gene_expression', 'FOXP3')

Recombinant NFAT1 can mediate transcription of the interleukin-2, interleukin-4, tumor necrosis factor alpha, and granulocyte-macrophage colony-stimulating factor promoters in T cells, suggesting that NFAT1 contributes to the CsA-sensitive transcription of these genes during the immune response.
('NFAT1', 'Transcription', 'interleukin-4'),('NFAT1', 'Transcription', 'interleukin-2'),('NFAT1', 'Transcription', 'granulocyte-macrophage colony-stimulating factor'),('NFAT1', 'Transcription', 'tumor necrosis factor alpha')

Both c-Rel and RelA induced jagged1 gene expression, whereas a mutant defective for transactivation did not.
('c-Rel', 'Gene_expression', 'jagged1'),('RelA', 'Gene_expression', 'jagged1')

Importantly, jagged1 transcripts were also upregulated by endogenous NF-kappaB activation and this effect was inhibited by a dominant mutant of IkappaBalpha, a physiological inhibitor of NF-kappaB.
('IkappaBalpha', 'Positive_regulation', 'jagged1')

These results demonstrate that c-Rel can trigger the Notch signaling pathway in neighboring cells by inducing jagged1 gene expression, and suggest a role for Jagged1 in B-cell activation, differentiation or function.
('c-Rel', 'Gene_expression', 'jagged1')

GATA-3 determines Th2 cell differentiation and selectively activates the promoters of IL-4, IL-5, and IL-13 through chromatin remodelling [4]-[7].
('GATA-3', 'Gene_expression', '-13'),('GATA-3', 'Gene_expression', 'IL-5')

The key role of GATA-3 in allergic airway inflammation has been demonstrated in mice by the reduced release of Th2 cytokines in animals treated with dominant-negative mutants of GATA-3 and by local application of antisense oligonucleotides to GATA-3 [8],[9].
('GATA-3', 'Binding', 'GATA-3')

Corticosteroids mediate their anti-inflammatory effects through binding to glucocorticoid receptors (GRs), which then translocate to the nucleus where they interact with glucocorticoid response elements (GREs) in the promoter regions of steroid-sensitive genes.
('GR', 'Localization', 'GR')

Using overexpression and CAT-reporter genes, Lavender and colleagues [33] have shown that GR reduced GATA-3-mediated IL-5 and -13 promoter activity in human CD4+ T cells.
('GATA-3', 'Gene_expression', '-13'),('GR', 'Binding', 'GATA-3'),('GATA-3', 'Gene_expression', 'IL-5')

The authors postulated that local recruitment of GR may alter the ability of GATA-3 either to bind to its target site, to cause transcriptional up-regulation, or to maintain an environment that is permissive for transcription.
('GR', 'Binding', 'GATA-3')

However, although Wnt signals are known to inhibit the activity of the negative regulatory protein kinase glycogen synthase kinase-3beta (GSK-3beta), resulting in increased levels of beta-catenin, we find no evidence for involvement of GSK-3beta in Tcf-mediated transcription in T cells.
('GSK-3beta', 'Positive_regulation', 'beta-catenin')

IL-10 Production by Th2 and Th17 Cells Also Requires ERK1 and ERK2 Activation
('ERK2', 'Gene_expression', 'IL-10'),('ERK1', 'Gene_expression', 'IL-10')

To address whether IL-10 production by Th2 and Th17 cells was also dependent on ERK1 and ERK2 activation, we differentiated these cells with anti-CD3 and anti-CD28 in the absence of APCs (Shoemaker et al., 2006; Veldhoen et al., 2009; Veldhoen et al., 2006), in the presence or absence of the MEK inhibitor (PD184352).
('ERK2', 'Gene_expression', 'IL-10'),('ERK1', 'Gene_expression', 'IL-10'),('MEK', 'Gene_expression', 'IL-10')

We showed that ERK1 and ERK2 activation is a common pathway required for induction of IL-10 in different Th cell subsets because IL-10 production by both Th2 and Th17 cells was markedly inhibited in the presence of the MEK inhibitor (PD184352) (Figure 5D and Figure S5B).
('ERK2', 'Gene_expression', 'IL-10'),('ERK1', 'Gene_expression', 'IL-10'),('MEK', 'Gene_expression', 'IL-10')

Activation of the ERK1 and ERK2 signaling pathway is therefore a common requirement for the induction of IL-10 production by Th1, Th2, and Th17 cells.
('ERK2', 'Gene_expression', 'IL-10'),('ERK1', 'Gene_expression', 'IL-10')

Although TGF-beta-reduced CD25, IL-4 expression, and CD25 expression (Figure 6B), IL-4 significantly inhibited TGF-beta-mediated induction of FOXP3 in naive T cells driven toward FOXP3+ T cells, as shown by FACS analysis (Figure 6A).
('TGF-beta', 'Gene_expression', 'FOXP3'),('TGF-beta', 'Gene_expression', 'IL-4'),('IL-4', 'Gene_expression', 'FOXP3'),('TGF-beta', 'Gene_expression', 'CD25'),('IL-4', 'Positive_regulation', 'FOXP3'),('IL-4', 'Negative_regulation', 'CD25')

It is known that IL-4 is a potent growth factor and may therefore favor the proliferation of FOXP3- cells and thus decrease the relative percentage of FOXP3+ cells.
('IL-4', 'Gene_expression', 'FOXP3'),('IL-4', 'Positive_regulation', 'FOXP3')

However, analysis of cell division kinetics by CFSE-labeling demonstrated that IL-4 did not differentially promote cell growth of FOXP3+ over that of FOXP3-.
('IL-4', 'Gene_expression', 'FOXP3'),('IL-4', 'Positive_regulation', 'FOXP3')

Furthermore the TGF-beta-mediated induction of FOXP3 expression was not caused by overgrowth of a CD25-FOXP3+ minority, since the number of FOXP3+ cells was low/absent in the purified CD4+CD45RA+ T cells (between 0% and 1%), and the FOXP3+ cells were not confined to the highly divided cells.
('TGF-beta', 'Gene_expression', 'FOXP3'),('TGF-beta', 'Gene_expression', 'CD25')

CD25 was down-regulated in TGF-beta-treated cells compare to activated T cells, which was even more pronounced in cells cultured with TGF-beta and IL-4.
('TGF-beta', 'Gene_expression', 'IL-4'),('TGF-beta', 'Gene_expression', 'CD25'),('IL-4', 'Negative_regulation', 'CD25')

The addition of IL-4 to iTreg-driving conditions decreased the number of FOXP3+ cells (Figure 6B).
('IL-4', 'Gene_expression', 'FOXP3'),('IL-4', 'Positive_regulation', 'FOXP3')

In line with the previous findings, the IL-4-producing cells and the FOXP3 expressing cells are nonoverlapping populations.
('IL-4', 'Gene_expression', 'FOXP3'),('IL-4', 'Positive_regulation', 'FOXP3')

The expression kinetic of naive T cells exposed to IL-4 and TGF-beta demonstrated that GATA3 and FOXP3 are initially found in separate populations (day 2), but transiently co-express both factors (days 4-8), before establishing separate populations at the end of the differentiation process (day 10; Figure 6C), suggesting that GATA3 inhibits the development of iTreg cells by repressing FOXP3.
('TGF-beta', 'Gene_expression', 'FOXP3'),('TGF-beta', 'Gene_expression', 'IL-4'),('IL-4', 'Gene_expression', 'FOXP3'),('IL-4', 'Gene_expression', 'GATA3'),('TGF-beta', 'Gene_expression', 'GATA3'),('IL-4', 'Positive_regulation', 'FOXP3')

These results showed that IL-4 acts in vitro as an inhibitor of FOXP3 expression, without interfering with TGF-beta signaling, probably acting at the level of transcription factors, and possibly by a GATA3-dependent mechanism.
('TGF-beta', 'Gene_expression', 'FOXP3'),('TGF-beta', 'Gene_expression', 'IL-4'),('IL-4', 'Gene_expression', 'FOXP3'),('IL-4', 'Gene_expression', 'GATA3'),('TGF-beta', 'Gene_expression', 'GATA3'),('IL-4', 'Positive_regulation', 'FOXP3')

Human CD3-CD16+ natural killer cells express the hGATA-3 T cell transcription factor and an unrearranged 2.3-kb TcR delta transcript.
('hGATA-3', 'Transcription', 'TcR delta'),('hGATA-3', 'Gene_expression', 'TcR delta')

The expression of hGATA-3, a T cell-specific factor known to be involved in the regulation of the transcription of TcR delta locus, was analyzed by Northern blot, in cultured NK cell population and clones (but not in freshly derived cell populations).
('hGATA-3', 'Transcription', 'TcR delta'),('hGATA-3', 'Gene_expression', 'TcR delta')

All NK clones and cell lines studied were found to express hGATA-3-specific mRNA, suggesting that hGATA-3 may be involved in the regulation of the unrearranged TcR delta gene expression in NK cells.
('hGATA-3', 'Transcription', 'TcR delta'),('hGATA-3', 'Gene_expression', 'TcR delta')

LMP1 Upregulates IL10 Expression and Constitutively Activates Stat3
('LMP1', 'Gene_expression', 'IL10')

(A) Relative expression of IL10, IL15, and IFNgamma mRNA in WT and LMP1 transgenic B cells (CD19+), as detected with an Rnase protection assay.
('LMP1', 'Gene_expression', 'IL10')

(B and C) Immunoblot analysis of activated pStat3 in purified B cells (CD19+) from WT and LMP1 transgenic mice (B) at the time of harvest, and (C) 4 h after culture with or without IL10, a neutralizing antibody to IL10, or a rat IgG1 isotype control.
('LMP1', 'Gene_expression', 'IL10')

LMP1 Upregulates IL10 and Constitutively Activates Stat3
('LMP1', 'Positive_regulation', 'IL10'),('IL10', 'Positive_regulation', 'Stat3')

Transcription of IL10, IL15, and IFNgamma were reproducibly detected in LMP1 transgenic lymphocytes and lymphoma cells and was higher than in the B cell lymphoma cell lines 967 and K46mu (Figure 5A).
('LMP1', 'Positive_regulation', 'IL10'),('LMP1', 'Positive_regulation', 'IFNgamma'),('LMP1', 'Positive_regulation', 'IL15')

There was no significant difference in the expression of IL15 and IFNgamma between LMP1 transgenic lymphocytes and lymphoma cells, suggesting that upregulation of IL15 and IFNgamma is induced by LMP1 expression in healthy lymphocytes but is not a unique property of malignant lymphocytes.
('LMP1', 'Positive_regulation', 'IFNgamma'),('LMP1', 'Positive_regulation', 'IL15')

Strikingly, IL10, a B lymphocyte stimulatory cytokine, was increased 1.5- to 5-fold in the wild-type and LMP1 transgenic lymphoma cells compared to LMP1 transgenic lymphocytes (Figure 5A).
('LMP1', 'Positive_regulation', 'IL10')

Immunoblot analysis indicated that LMP1 transgenic lymphocytes and wild-type and LMP1 transgenic lymphoma cells had corresponding increased levels of phosphorylated alpha and beta isoforms of activated Stat3, a target of the IL10 receptor (Figure 5B).
('LMP1', 'Positive_regulation', 'IL10'),('IL10', 'Positive_regulation', 'Stat3')

However, when comparing the same lymphomas, there was no correlation between the levels of IL10 induction and the levels of Stat3 activation.
('IL10', 'Positive_regulation', 'Stat3')

This suggests that the activation of Stat3 is not solely induced by IL10 or that Stat3 activation may be constitutive.
('IL10', 'Positive_regulation', 'Stat3')

Additionally, there was no correlation between the levels of LMP1 expression and the levels of IL10 induction (Figures 1A and 5A).
('LMP1', 'Positive_regulation', 'IL10')

This indicates that the induction of IL10 is a general property associated with enhanced survival and may only be indirectly affected by LMP1.
('LMP1', 'Positive_regulation', 'IL10')

Neutralizing antibodies to IL10 did not affect the survival of lymphoma cells as determined by the MTS assay (unpublished data), suggesting constitutive activation of Stat3.
('IL10', 'Positive_regulation', 'Stat3')

This was confirmed by immunoblot analysis such that in the presence of anti-IL10 neutralizing antibodies, pStat3 levels remained activated in lymphoma cells isolated from wild-type and LMP1 transgenic lymphomas (Figure 5C).
('LMP1', 'Positive_regulation', 'IL10'),('IL10', 'Positive_regulation', 'pStat3'),('IL10', 'Positive_regulation', 'Stat3')

Exogenous addition of IL10 enhanced pStat3 activation above constitutive levels, indicating that lymphoma cells are responsive to IL10 treatment (Figure 5C).
('IL10', 'Positive_regulation', 'pStat3'),('IL10', 'Positive_regulation', 'Stat3')

This means that although the lymphoma cells have constitutive Stat3 activation, it may be further enhanced by IL10 induction.
('IL10', 'Positive_regulation', 'Stat3')

Nuclear translocation of pStat3 is a consequence of activation, and nuclear pStat3 was not detected by immunohistochemistry staining of spleen sections from control mice.
('pStat3', 'Localization', 'pStat3')

Role of CBFbeta in the induction of Foxp3
('CBFbeta', 'Gene_expression', 'Foxp3')

To target all Runx proteins that might be involved in the induction of Foxp3, we used mice in which loxP-flanked Cbfb alleles were inactivated in T cells through expression of a CD4-cre transgene.
('Runx', 'Gene_expression', 'Foxp3'),('Runx', 'Positive_regulation', 'Foxp3')

Retinoic acid and TGF-beta synergize in the induction of Foxp3 in naive T cells (Kang et al., 2007).
('TGF-beta', 'Gene_expression', 'Foxp3')

To investigate whether Runx-mediated induction of Foxp3 is dependent on the expression of CBFbeta, naive CD4+ CD8- T cells from CbfbF/F CD4-cre and control CbfbF/+ CD4-cre mice were stimulated with anti-CD3/28 mAbs, retinoic acid, and increasing concentrations of TGF-beta.
('TGF-beta', 'Gene_expression', 'Foxp3'),('Runx', 'Gene_expression', 'Foxp3'),('CBFbeta', 'Gene_expression', 'Foxp3'),('Runx', 'Positive_regulation', 'Foxp3')

After 3 d in culture, the cells were restimulated with PMA and ionomycin and analyzed for intracellular Foxp3 and IFN-gamma expression.
('IFN-gamma', 'Gene_expression', 'Foxp3')

TGF-beta induced Foxp3 in CbfbF/+ CD4-cre cells in a dose dependent manner, and this was significantly reduced in CbfbF/F CD4-cre cells.
('TGF-beta', 'Gene_expression', 'Foxp3')

Retinoic acid enhanced Foxp3 expression even in 20 pg/ml of TGF-beta and more than 95% of the CD4+ T cells from CbfbF/+ CD4-cre mice became Foxp3+ in 100 and 500 pg/ml TGF-beta doses.
('TGF-beta', 'Gene_expression', 'Foxp3')

The induction of Foxp3 was again significantly lower in CbfbF/F CD4-cre CD4+ T cells even in the presence of retinoic acid, demonstrating that deficiency in Runx binding to DNA affects the TGF-beta induction of Foxp3 in T reg cells (Fig.
('TGF-beta', 'Gene_expression', 'Foxp3'),('Runx', 'Gene_expression', 'Foxp3'),('Runx', 'Positive_regulation', 'Foxp3')

There was no difference in the induction of Foxp3 when endogenous IL-4 and IFN-gamma were neutralized (Fig.
('IL-4', 'Gene_expression', 'Foxp3'),('IFN-gamma', 'Gene_expression', 'Foxp3')

The importance of RUNX transcription factors for the in vivo conversion of naive CD4+ T cells into iT reg cells was examined.
('RUNX', 'Gene_expression', 'CD4')

These data affirm the significance of RUNX proteins for the in vivo generation of CD4+ Foxp3+ T cells.
('RUNX', 'Gene_expression', 'Foxp3'),('RUNX', 'Gene_expression', 'CD4')

Regulation of FOXP3 promoter activity and FOXP3 protein expression by RUNX1 and RUNX3

('RUNX3', 'Positive_regulation', 'FOXP3'),('RUNX1', 'Gene_expression', 'FOXP3'),('RUNX1', 'Positive_regulation', 'FOXP3'),('RUNX', 'Positive_regulation', 'FOXP3'),('RUNX3', 'Gene_expression', 'FOXP3')

('RUNX3', 'Positive_regulation', 'FOXP3'),('RUNX1', 'Gene_expression', 'FOXP3'),('RUNX1', 'Positive_regulation', 'FOXP3'),('RUNX', 'Positive_regulation', 'FOXP3'),('RUNX3', 'Gene_expression', 'FOXP3')

In these experiments, the overexpression of RUNX1 and RUNX3 eliminated the need of TGF-beta for FOXP3 promoter activation and PMA/ionomycin stimulation was sufficient.
('RUNX3', 'Positive_regulation', 'FOXP3'),('RUNX1', 'Gene_expression', 'FOXP3'),('TGF-beta', 'Positive_regulation', 'FOXP3'),('RUNX1', 'Positive_regulation', 'FOXP3'),('RUNX', 'Positive_regulation', 'FOXP3'),('RUNX3', 'Gene_expression', 'FOXP3')

To examine the role of each of the three RUNX binding sites for the FOXP3 promoter activity, we mutated each individually or in combination.
('RUNX', 'Positive_regulation', 'FOXP3')

4 B), suggesting that the identified binding sites have redundant functions and RUNX binding to more than one site is necessary for the full activation of the FOXP3 promoter.
('RUNX', 'Positive_regulation', 'FOXP3')

Supporting these findings, the overexpression of RUNX1 in human primary CD4+ T cells resulted in significantly elevated levels of FOXP3 protein measured by flow cytometry after 48 h. This was achieved without any requirement for anti-CD3, anti-CD28 stimulation, or the presence of TGF-beta.
('RUNX1', 'Gene_expression', 'FOXP3'),('TGF-beta', 'Positive_regulation', 'FOXP3'),('RUNX1', 'Positive_regulation', 'FOXP3'),('RUNX', 'Positive_regulation', 'FOXP3')

Regulation of M-CSF expression by M-CSF: role of protein kinase C and transcription factor NF kappa B.
('M-CSF', 'Gene_expression', 'M-CSF')

The detection of both M-CSF and c-fms expression by cells of the monocyte lineage has suggested that M-CSF may act by an autocrine mechanism.
('M-CSF', 'Gene_expression', 'M-CSF')

Although sensitivity to M-CSF can be modulated by regulation of receptor expression and function, M-CSF responsiveness is largely determined at a postreceptor level.
('M-CSF', 'Gene_expression', 'M-CSF')

Inhibition of PKC by the isoquinoline derivative H7 abolishes induction of M-CSF by M-CSF.
('M-CSF', 'Gene_expression', 'M-CSF')

The results suggest that M-CSF induction of M-CSF involves G proteins, PKC and NF kappa B.
('M-CSF', 'Gene_expression', 'M-CSF')

BACKGROUND: The induction of vascular cell adhesion molecule-1 (VCAM-1) and E-selectin by tumor necrosis factor-alpha (TNF) is mediated by mobilization of the transcription factor nuclear factor-kappa B (NF-kappa B).
('TNF', 'Localization', 'VCAM-1'),('TNF', 'Localization', 'E-selectin')

Induction of VCAM-1 and E-selectin surface expression by TNF was dose-dependently reduced by aspirin over the same range, while induction of intercellular adhesion molecule-1 (ICAM-1) was hardly affected.
('TNF', 'Localization', 'VCAM-1'),('TNF', 'Localization', 'E-selectin')

Aspirin appeared to prevent VCAM-1 transcription, since it dose-dependently inhibited induction of VCAM-1 mRNA by TNF.
('TNF', 'Localization', 'VCAM-1')

As a functional consequence, adhesion of U937 monocytes to TNF-stimulated HUVECs was markedly reduced by aspirin due to suppression of VCAM-1 and E-selectin upregulation.
('TNF', 'Localization', 'VCAM-1'),('TNF', 'Localization', 'E-selectin')

CONCLUSIONS: Our data suggest that aspirin inhibits NF-kappa B mobilization, induction of VCAM-1 and E-selectin, and subsequent monocyte adhesion in endothelial cells stimulated by TNF, thereby providing an additional mechanism for therapeutic effects of aspirin.
('TNF', 'Localization', 'VCAM-1'),('TNF', 'Localization', 'E-selectin')

GATA3-Driven Th2 Responses Inhibit TGF-beta1-Induced FOXP3 Expression and the Formation of Regulatory T Cells
('TGF-beta1', 'Gene_expression', 'FOXP3')

This inhibitory mechanism was also confirmed in Th2 cells and in T cells of transgenic mice overexpressing GATA-3 in T cells, which are shown to be deficient in transforming growth factor (TGF)-beta-mediated FOXP3 induction.
('transforming growth factor (TGF)-beta', 'Positive_regulation', 'FOXP3')

('CIITA', 'Positive_regulation', 'DR alpha')

Recent studies indicate that HTLV-1 Tax targets IkappaBalpha to the ubiquitin-proteasome pathway.
('Tax', 'Protein_catabolism', 'IkappaBalpha')

In this report, we provide evidence that in addition to acting on IkappaBalpha, Tax stimulates the turnover Of IkappaBbeta via a related targeting mechanism.
('Tax', 'Protein_catabolism', 'IkappaBalpha'),('Tax', 'Protein_catabolism', 'IkappaBbeta')

Like IkappaBalpha, Tax-mediated breakdown of IkappaBbeta in transfected T lymphocytes is blocked either by cell-permeable proteasome inhibitors or by mutation Of IkappaBbeta at two serine residues present within its N-terminal region.
('Tax', 'Protein_catabolism', 'IkappaBalpha'),('Tax', 'Protein_catabolism', 'IkappaBbeta')

Despite the dual specificity of HTLV-1 Tax for IkappaBalpha and IkappaBbeta at the protein level, Tax selectively stimulates NF-kappaB-directed transcription of the IkappaBalpha gene.
('Tax', 'Protein_catabolism', 'IkappaBalpha'),('Tax', 'Protein_catabolism', 'IkappaBbeta')

These findings with IkappaBbeta provide a potential mechanism for the constitutive activation of NF-kappaB in Tax-expressing cells.
('Tax', 'Protein_catabolism', 'IkappaBbeta')

Histamine transiently increased cAMP and c-fos expression through H2 receptors.
('H2 receptors', 'Gene_expression', 'c-fos')

Dose-dependence studies using histamine and dimaprit showed that the EC50 values for cAMP production and c-fos increase were similar, suggesting that cAMP might be involved in c-fos induction via H2 receptors.
('H2 receptors', 'Gene_expression', 'c-fos')

These results indicate that histamine activates several mechanisms involved in the induction of differentiation, such as cAMP and c-fos production, but fails to promote differentiation of U937 cells, apparently due to the rapid desensitization of H2 receptors.
('H2 receptors', 'Gene_expression', 'c-fos')

Role of EGR1 in regulation of stimulus-dependent CD44 transcription in B lymphocytes.
('EGR1', 'Positive_regulation', 'CD44')

Here we identify the gene encoding the lymphocyte homing and migration protein CD44 as a target of EGR1 regulation in B cells.
('EGR1', 'Positive_regulation', 'CD44')

BCR-induced increases in CD44 mRNA expression and transcription levels are shown to occur in EGR1-expressing but not in nonexpressing subclones of the B-cell line WEHI-231.
('EGR1', 'Positive_regulation', 'CD44')

Kinetics of egr-1 transcription and the appearance of nuclear EGR1 protein precede CD44 induction and occur within 30 min after stimulation in the EGR1-expressing subclone.
('EGR1', 'Positive_regulation', 'CD44')

A single EGR1 binding motif is demonstrated at bp -301 of the human CD44 promoter.
('EGR1', 'Positive_regulation', 'CD44')

The EGR1 binding motif was shown to be necessary for stimulus-induced expression of a CD44 promoter-chloramphenicol acetyltransferase reporter construct in nontransformed B lymphocytes and was required for transactivation by an EGR1 expression vector in a B-cell line.
('EGR1', 'Positive_regulation', 'CD44')

These studies identify EGR1 as an intermediary linking BCR-derived signals to the induction of CD44.
('EGR1', 'Positive_regulation', 'CD44')

Here, we show that v-erbA and c-erbA bind directly to sequences within the promoter of the erythrocyte-specific carbonic anhydrase II (CAII), a gene whose transcription is efficiently suppressed by v-erbA.
('v-erbA', 'Transcription', 'CAII'),('v-erbA', 'Regulation', 'CAII')

This erbA-binding site confers thyroid hormone responsiveness to a heterologous promoter in transient expression experiments and is a target for efficient down-regulation of CAII transcription by the v-erbA oncoprotein.
('v-erbA', 'Transcription', 'CAII'),('v-erbA', 'Regulation', 'CAII')

('v-erbA', 'Transcription', 'CAII'),('v-erbA', 'Regulation', 'CAII')

In the present report, we studied the role of the stromal-derived cytokine interleukin-7 (IL-7) in the IL-2-gene regulation in activated T lymphocytes.
('IL-7', 'Transcription', 'IL-2'),('IL-7', 'Regulation', 'IL-2')

Costimulation of phytohemagglutinin/anti-CD28 activated T lymphocytes with IL-7 induces a fivefold enhanced IL-2-mRNA accumulation and a 2.5-fold enhanced protein secretion.
('IL-7', 'Transcription', 'IL-2'),('IL-7', 'Regulation', 'IL-2')

The IL-2-gene transcription rate is increased 3.4-fold, indicating that the effect of IL-7 is in part mediated at the transcriptional level.
('IL-7', 'Transcription', 'IL-2'),('IL-7', 'Regulation', 'IL-2')

Activation of the interleukin 6 gene by Mycobacterium tuberculosis or lipopolysaccharide is mediated by nuclear factors NF-IL6 and NF-kappa B [published erratum appears in Proc Natl Acad Sci U S A 1995 Apr 11;92(8):3632]
('NF-IL6', 'Positive_regulation', 'interleukin 6')

The role of the viral trans-activator Tax protein in the induction of VCAM-1 was first indicated by the detection of this adhesion molecule on Jurkat T-cell clones stably expressing the tax gene.
('Tax', 'Positive_regulation', 'VCAM-1'),('Tax', 'Transcription', 'VCAM-1'),('Tax', 'Gene_expression', 'VCAM-1')

The effect of Tax on VCAM-1 gene transcription was next confirmed in JPX-9 cells, a subclone of Jurkat cells, carrying the tax sequences under the control of an inducible promoter.
('Tax', 'Positive_regulation', 'VCAM-1'),('Tax', 'Transcription', 'VCAM-1'),('Tax', 'Gene_expression', 'VCAM-1')

Furthermore, deletion and mutation analyses of the VCAM-1 promoter performed with chloramphenicol acetyltransferase constructs revealed that Tax was trans activating the VCAM-1 promoter via two NF-kappaB sites present at bp -72 and -57 in the VCAM-1 gene promoter, with both of them being required for the Tax-induced expression of this adhesion molecule.
('Tax', 'Positive_regulation', 'VCAM-1'),('Tax', 'Transcription', 'VCAM-1'),('Tax', 'Gene_expression', 'VCAM-1')

Finally, gel mobility shift assays demonstrated the nuclear translocation of proteins specifically bound to these two NF-kappaB motifs, confirming that VCAM-1 was induced on Tax-expressing cells in a kappaB-dependent manner.
('Tax', 'Positive_regulation', 'VCAM-1'),('Tax', 'Transcription', 'VCAM-1'),('Tax', 'Gene_expression', 'VCAM-1')

Collectively, these results therefore suggest that the exclusive Tax-induced expression of VCAM-1 on T cells may represent a pivotal event in the progression of HTLV-1-associated diseases.
('Tax', 'Positive_regulation', 'VCAM-1'),('Tax', 'Transcription', 'VCAM-1'),('Tax', 'Gene_expression', 'VCAM-1')
